fields.title: About Us
fields.content:
What's the background to this site?

mySociety is often approached by people who would like to volunteer to help with our transparency and democracy websites like TheyWorkForYou.com and FixMyStreet.com. This site is a great chance to get involved as an active community member of mySociety without having to learn how to be a computer programmer.

What is the site actually for?

We're asking people to sign up to be constiuency volunteers for mySociety and our friends who run TheStraightChoice.org. What this means is putting yourself forward to help with tasks such as:

  • Helping to establish who is standing for election at the next general election in your constituency, so that we can tell the public about them, share that information with other websites, and gather information on their political views.
  • Which local campaigns and issues need putting to candidates in order to have a clear record of candidates views on the issues that matter to local people
  • What election materials are being sent around, containing what promises and what accucations.

We promise we won't hammer you with requests, in fact the sum total of volunteering between now and the general election could easily be less than a dozen hours. But it all matters because the only people who know what's important in every corner of the country are people like you.

Can I sign up as a volunteer to cover more than one constituency?

Yes, we know that people often have quite detailed knowledge of several constituencies, so we're enabling people to sign up to volunteer for three constituencies each. However, the constituency for which you enter your postcode will be considered your primary patch.

How is my volunteering going to help you make better websites at the election?

We know from the success of TheyWorkForYou that people like clear, no-nonsense, politically neutral information on their politicians - what they said, how they voted, whether they ever showed up, and so on.

This information is never more valuable than in the run up to a general election, but it is really hard to find out who's running in an election. And even when you have found out, their views are often recorded in a thousand different places, not nicely findable when you need them, via Google.

We plan to ask all candidates at the next general election certain questions about a wide range of policy issues, some written by mySociety, some written by national campaign groups, and many written just for certain local candidates by local people and local organisations. We can build the software which will send these questions, and which will record and share the responses given by candidates on our own, just the little mySociety core team. However what we can't do is find out everyone who is standing across the UK, and we can't possibly find out what local-specific questions need asking to get a rounded view of all candidates. This is where you come in.

Can I share the job with other local people?

We very much hope that many volunteers will sign up in the same constituencies. In these cases we will use email to put volunteers in touch with each other to make up their own minds how to divvy up tasks, identify local issues, and so on.
